sn56.36:1.1: “Suppose a person was to strip all the grass, sticks, branches, and leaves in the Black Plum Tree Land, gather them together into one pile,
sn56.36:1.3: Then they’d impale the large creatures in the ocean on large stakes; the medium-sized creatures on medium-sized stakes; and the small creatures on small stakes.
sn56.36:1.4: They wouldn’t run out of sizable creatures in the ocean before
sn56.36:2.1: using up all the grass, sticks, branches, and leaves in the Black Plum Tree Land.
sn56.36:2.2: There are far more small creatures in the ocean than this, so it wouldn’t be feasible to impale them on stakes.
sn56.36:2.4: Because of the small size of those life-forms.
sn56.36:2.5: That’s how big the plane of loss is.
sn56.36:2.6: An individual accomplished in view, exempt from that vast plane of loss, truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
sn56.36:3.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
